channel.title: Data Visualization on Gabby Kendall's Data Science Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Data Visualization on Gabby Kendall's Data Science Blog

item.title: Histograms
item.description: Now we are moving onto histograms! Letâ€™s look at the weights of MLB players throught the Master table in the Lahman database. library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) Below is the sqldf inquiry: query<-"SELECT weight FROM Master" result<-sqldf(query) #The next step is like the other visualizations, putting it in the ggplot script. ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data=result,aes(x=weight),color="blue",fill="white",bins=60)+ ggtitle("Distribution of Baseball Player Bodyweight")+ xlab("Weight of player")+ ylab("Number of players") See the histogram was not too bad! The bins we see on this visualization represent the numbers of bars shown.
